page.title: 01Description - Bodenham area
page.content: This picturesque area consists of farmland, woodland, water tracts of the gravel pits, the river Lugg and the village of Bodenham.Farming is mixed - cereal,vegetables,soft fruit, orchards, dairy produce, sheep, pigs and beef cattle.The privately owned woodlands are mostly broadleaved with the exception of one commercial conifer wood. The gravel pits, coming to the end of their supply, are lakes of water for the greater part.The river Lugg flows through this area and is in the care of the Welsh Water Authority.Bodenham village is a thriving community.There are a number of older dwellings, some dating back to the 16th century, a 13th century church, an estate of modern houses, bungalows for the aged, a new surgery, a shop with sub post office, a garage and a chapel, and a public house.
